newsitem.title: INDONESIA: At least 11 die in Indonesian aircraft crash.
newsitem.headline: At least 11 die in Indonesian aircraft crash.

text.p: At least 11 people died when an Indonesian Fokker 27 aircraft crashed on Thursday near the West Java town of Bandung, a rescue official said.

"Eleven people died, 18 were saved and the rest of the 50 people on board are not yet unaccounted for," the official in the Bandung office of the National Search and Rescue organisation told Reuters. Police had earlier said there were 46 passengers and five crew on board the Dutch-made twin-engined turboprop aircraft.
An airport official at Bandung's Husein Sastranegara airport said the Sempati Airlines plane crashed about 13 km (eight miles) from Bandung nine minutes after take-off.
The official Antara news agency said the plane went down at the Margahayu Permai housing complex in the Bandung regency, but there was no immediate word on casualties.
Officials said traffic was very bad on the roads around Bandung, a hill city surrounded by volcanic mountains, some of which are still active.
